title: 'Truly awful' ITV Nightly Show is huge flop with viewers as host David Walliams is slammed for 'gut wrenching' presenting
text:
TV 'Truly awful' ITV Nightly Show is huge flop with viewers as host David Walliams is slammed for 'gut wrenching' presenting The channel's latest chat show and its host were mercilessly panned by viewers just minutes into its first outing Share Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
It's the latest attempt to bring an American-style chat show to the UK. 
But ITV's The Nightly Show caused a storm on social media for all the wrong reasons during its premiere on Monday night, with fans panning the programme. 
Taking to Twitter to vent their anger and dissatisfaction with the show, viewers were quick to slam the show - mainly for its host David Walliams ' "gut wrenching" performance. 
David Walliams reveals Dannii Minogue once 'booty called' him as a joke on Radio 2 Turning viewers off (Photo: Rex Features) 
Just minutes into its run in the 10pm slot on Monday, Twitter erupted with furious and disappointed messages from viewers across the UK. 
Not impressed with the chat show taking over the News at Ten's slot, viewers were quick to slam the show for its weak format (with Martin Clunes as the first star guest) and the decision to have David, 45, in the driving seat. 
One fan, @Pumpwater1, blasted: "@ITV David Walliams Nightlyshow is truly awful, gut wrenching rubbish. Martin Clunes is virtually incoherent, pathetic drivel turned it off [sic]. David Walliams was blasted for his hosting skills on ITV's The Nightly Show (Photo: Rex Features) 
And it seems that many others agreed with those sentiments, as ElfanAprees wrote: "Sorry but 7 minutes of The Nightly Show and David Walliams self preening into an autocue is seven minutes of my life lost [sic]." 
"The wonder, surely, is that somebody thought a nightly show presented by David Walliams WOULDN'T be terrible," wrote @hellothisisivan. 
And, despite some viewers complaining of a lack of star-power on the sofa, it was the choice of David as host that truly sunk the show in the eyes of many viewers. (Photo: Rex Features) Read More Paw guy! David Walliams left red-faced after dog URINATES in his shoe during Britain's Got Talent audition 
"I could be watching The Nightly Show. But David Walliams is the host. Martin Clunes is a guest. And it's on ITV. Don't think I'll bother," wrote @andrewpunton. 
Another disappointed viewer exclaimed: "The nightly show is a great idea, shame its got David Walliams hosting it!!" 
The show, which has been touted as the UK's answer to the USA's The Late Night Show and The Tonight Show, debuted on Monday with the Britain's Got Talent judge set to host its first week. 
However, the comedian will not be a permanent fixture, as the hosting duties are set to rotate weekly. 
Other stars lined-up to helm the programme include: John Bishop, Davina McCall and Gordon Ramsay. 
The Nightly Show with David Walliams will air at 10pm on ITV this week on Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday and Friday. Like us on Facebook
